SEARCH
Package com.otabi.jcodroneedu

Class FlightController

java.lang.Object
com.otabi.jcodroneedu.FlightController
public class FlightController extends Object
Manages the direct flight control and flight-related commands for the drone.

  • Constructor Details

    • FlightController

      public FlightController(Drone drone)

  • Method Details

    • takeoff

      public void takeoff()
      Commands the drone to take off. This method is blocking and follows a two-stage process: 1. It repeatedly sends the takeoff command until the drone reports its state as TAKEOFF. 2. It then waits until the drone reports its state as FLIGHT, indicating it's stable and ready. Both stages have timeouts to prevent the program from hanging.

    • land

      public void land()
      Commands the drone to land gently. This method is blocking and follows a two-stage process: 1. It repeatedly sends the landing command until the drone reports its state as LANDING. 2. It then waits until the drone reports its state as READY, indicating the landing is complete. Both stages have timeouts to prevent the program from hanging.

    • emergencyStop

      public void emergencyStop()
      Sends a command to stop all motors immediately.

    • hover

      public void hover(double durationSeconds)
      Commands the drone to hover in place for a specific duration by sending a single command to cease all movement and then pausing the thread.
      Parameters:
      durationSeconds - The duration to hover, in seconds (matching Python behavior).

    • resetMoveValues

      public void resetMoveValues(int attempts)
      Resets the values of roll, pitch, yaw, and throttle to 0 by sending a hover command multiple times to ensure the drone is stable.
      Parameters:
      attempts - The number of times the hover command is sent.

    • resetMoveValues

      public void resetMoveValues()
      Resets the drone's movement values to zero.

    • changeSpeed

      public void changeSpeed(int speedLevel)
      Sets the drone's responsiveness level.
      Parameters:
      speedLevel - An integer from 1 (slow) to 3 (fast).

    • setHeadlessMode

      public void setHeadlessMode(boolean enable)
      Enables or disables headless mode.
      Parameters:
      enable - true to enable headless mode, false to disable.

    • triggerFlightEvent

      public void triggerFlightEvent(FlightController.FlightEvent event)
      Triggers a pre-programmed flight event.
      Parameters:
      event - The flight event to trigger.

    • setPitch

      public void setPitch(int pitch)
      This is a setter function that allows you to set the pitch variable. Once you set pitch, you have to use move() to actually execute the movement. The pitch variable will remain what you last set it until the end of the flight sequence, so you will have to set it back to 0 if you don't want the drone to pitch again.
      Parameters:
      pitch - Sets the pitch variable (-100 - 100). The number represents the direction and power of the output for that flight motion variable. Negative pitch is backwards, positive pitch is forwards.

    • setRoll

      public void setRoll(int roll)
      This is a setter function that allows you to set the roll variable. Once you set roll, you have to use move() to actually execute the movement. The roll variable will remain what you last set it until the end of the flight sequence, so you will have to set it back to 0 if you don't want the drone to roll again.
      Parameters:
      roll - Sets the roll variable (-100 - 100). The number represents the direction and power of the output for that flight motion variable. Negative roll is left, positive roll is right.

    • setYaw

      public void setYaw(int yaw)
      This is a setter function that allows you to set the yaw variable. Once you set yaw, you have to use move()to actually execute the movement. The yaw variable will remain what you last set it until the end of the flight sequence, so you will have to set it back to 0 if you don't want the drone to yaw again.
      Parameters:
      yaw - Sets the yaw variable (-100 - 100). The number represents the direction and power of the output for that flight motion variable. Negative yaw is right, positive yaw is left.

    • setThrottle

      public void setThrottle(int throttle)
      This is a setter function that allows you to set the throttle variable. Once you set throttle, you have to use move() to actually execute the movement. The throttle variable will remain what you last set it until the end of the flight sequence, so you will have to set it back to 0 if you don't want the drone to throttle again.
      Parameters:
      throttle - Sets the throttle variable (-100 - 100). The number represents the direction and power of the output for that flight motion variable. Negative throttle is down, positive throttle is up.

    • move

      public void move()
      Used with set_roll, set_pitch, set_yaw, set_throttle commands. Sends flight movement values to the drone.

    • move

      public void move(int duration)
      Used with set_roll, set_pitch, set_yaw, set_throttle commands. Sends flight movement values to the drone.
      Parameters:
      duration - Number of seconds to perform the action

      public byte[] getMoveValues()

    • sendControl

      public void sendControl(int roll, int pitch, int yaw, int throttle)
      Sends a single flight control command to the drone. The input values will be clamped to the range of -100 to 100.
      Parameters:
      roll - The roll value (-100 to 100).
      pitch - The pitch value (-100 to 100).
      yaw - The yaw value (-100 to 100).
      throttle - The throttle value (-100 to 100).

    • sendControlWhile

      public void sendControlWhile(int roll, int pitch, int yaw, int throttle, long timeMs)
      Continuously sends flight control commands for a specified duration.
      Parameters:
      roll - The roll value (-100 to 100).
      pitch - The pitch value (-100 to 100).
      yaw - The yaw value (-100 to 100).
      throttle - The throttle value (-100 to 100).
      timeMs - The duration to send commands for, in milliseconds.

    • sendControlPosition

      public void sendControlPosition(float positionX, float positionY, float positionZ, float velocity, int heading, int rotationalVelocity)
      Sends a position-based movement command to the drone.
      Parameters:
      positionX - The target position on the X-axis (Front/Back) in meters.
      positionY - The target position on the Y-axis (Left/Right) in meters.
      positionZ - The target position on the Z-axis (Up/Down) in meters.
      velocity - The speed to move towards the target position in m/s.
      heading - The target heading in degrees (-360 to 360).
      rotationalVelocity - The speed for turning in degrees/s.

    • go

      public void go(String direction, int power, int duration)
      Fly in a given direction for the given duration and power. This is the primary educational movement API, matching the Python implementation exactly. Students can use simple commands like drone.go("forward", 30, 1) for intuitive movement. Implementation matches Python's go() method: - Resets all control variables to 0 - Sets the appropriate control variable based on direction - Calls move(duration) to execute the movement - Calls hover(1) to stabilize after movement
      Parameters:
      direction - String direction: "forward", "backward", "left", "right", "up", "down"
      power - Power level from 0-100 (defaults to 50 if not specified)
      duration - Duration in seconds (defaults to 1 if not specified)

    • go

      public void go(String direction, int duration)
      Overloaded go() method with default power (50)

    • go

      public void go(String direction)
      Overloaded go() method with default power (50) and duration (1 second)

    • moveForward

      public void moveForward(double distance, String units, double speed)
      Move forward a specific distance with precision control. This method implements the Python move_forward() functionality, allowing students to move the drone a precise distance in centimeters, inches, meters, or feet.
      Parameters:
      distance - The distance to move forward
      units - The unit of measurement: "cm", "in", "ft", "m" (default: "cm")
      speed - The movement speed from 0.5 to 2.0 m/s (default: 0.5)

    • moveForward

      public void moveForward(double distance)

    • moveDistance

      public void moveDistance(double positionX, double positionY, double positionZ, double velocity)
      Move the drone in 3D space to a specific relative position. This method implements the Python move_distance() functionality, allowing students to move the drone simultaneously along X, Y, and Z axes.
      Parameters:
      positionX - The distance to move forward/backward in meters (+ forward, - backward)
      positionY - The distance to move left/right in meters (+ left, - right)
      positionZ - The distance to move up/down in meters (+ up, - down)
      velocity - The movement speed from 0.5 to 2.0 m/s

    • sendAbsolutePosition

      public void sendAbsolutePosition(double positionX, double positionY, double positionZ, double velocity, int heading, int rotationalVelocity)
      Send absolute position command to the drone. This method implements the Python send_absolute_position() functionality, allowing precise positioning relative to the takeoff point.
      Parameters:
      positionX - The absolute X position in meters from takeoff point
      positionY - The absolute Y position in meters from takeoff point
      positionZ - The absolute Z position in meters from takeoff point
      velocity - The movement speed from 0.5 to 2.0 m/s
      heading - The target heading in degrees (-360 to 360)
      rotationalVelocity - The rotational speed in degrees/s (10 to 360)

    • turn

      public void turn(int power, Double seconds)
      Turns the drone in the yaw direction (left/right rotation).

      This method replicates the Python turn(power, seconds) function, providing simple yaw control for educational use.

      Educational Context:
      - Basic turning for navigation and obstacle avoidance
      - Introduction to rotational movement concepts
      - Foundation for more complex turning patterns

      Parameters:
      power - The turning power (-100 to 100). Positive values turn left, negative values turn right.
      seconds - The duration to turn in seconds. If null, sends a single control command without duration.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if power is outside valid range
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • turnLeft(int)
      • turnRight(int)
      • turnDegree(int)

    • turnDegree

      public void turnDegree(int degree, double timeout, double pValue)
      Turns the drone to a specific degree relative to its initial heading.

      This method replicates the Python turn_degree(degree, timeout, p_value) function, providing precise angular control using a proportional controller.

      Educational Context:
      - Precise angular positioning for navigation
      - Introduction to closed-loop control concepts
      - Foundation for autonomous flight patterns

      Algorithm: Uses a proportional control system that calculates the shortest angular path to the target, applies appropriate turning power based on the angular error, and stops when the target is reached or timeout occurs.

      Parameters:
      degree - The target heading in degrees (-180 to 180). Positive values are relative left turns, negative values are relative right turns.
      timeout - Maximum time in seconds to attempt the turn (default: 3.0)
      pValue - Proportional gain for the control system (default: 10.0). Higher values result in faster, more aggressive turning.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if degree is outside valid range
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • turnLeft(int)
      • turnRight(int)
      • turn(int, Double)

    • turnDegree

      public void turnDegree(int degree, double timeout)
      Overloaded turnDegree with default timeout.

    • turnDegree

      public void turnDegree(int degree)
      Overloaded turnDegree with default timeout and pValue.

    • turnLeft

      public void turnLeft(int degrees, double timeout)
      Turns the drone left by the specified number of degrees.

      This method replicates the Python turn_left(degree, timeout) function, providing intuitive left turning for educational use.

      Educational Context:
      - Intuitive directional control for beginners
      - Building blocks for navigation patterns
      - Clear semantic meaning for student code readability

      Parameters:
      degrees - The number of degrees to turn left (0 to 179). Automatically converted to positive value.
      timeout - Maximum time in seconds to attempt the turn (default: 3.0)
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • turnRight(int, double)
      • turnDegree(int)
      • turn(int, Double)

    • turnLeft

      public void turnLeft(int degrees)
      Overloaded turnLeft with default timeout.

      Educational Context:
      - Intuitive directional control for beginners
      - Building blocks for navigation patterns
      - Clear semantic meaning for student code readability

      Parameters:
      degrees - The number of degrees to turn right (0 to 179). Automatically converted to positive value.
      timeout - Maximum time in seconds to attempt the turn (default: 3.0)
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • turnLeft(int, double)

    • get_accel

      public int[] get_accel()
      Gets accelerometer data as an array.

      Returns the raw accelerometer values from the protocol for all three axes. The protocol encodes accelerometer samples as signed 16-bit integers where the raw unit equals m/s^2 * 10 (i.e., multiply raw by DroneSystem.SensorScales.ACCEL_RAW_TO_MS2 to obtain m/s^2). This method is provided for AP CSA compatibility and educational examples that expect integer arrays. For human-friendly values, use getAccelX(), getAccelY(), and getAccelZ() which return acceleration in G (approx).

      Returns:
      int array containing [X, Y, Z] raw accelerometer protocol values
      Since:
      1.0

    • get_gyro

      public int[] get_gyro()
      Gets gyroscope data as an array.

      Returns rotational velocity data for all three axes in a convenient array format. This is useful for AP CSA students learning about arrays and rotational motion.

      Returns:
      int array containing [roll, pitch, yaw] gyroscope values in degrees/second
      Since:
      1.0

    • get_angle

      public int[] get_angle()
      Gets angle data as an array.

      Returns current orientation angles for all three axes in a convenient array format. This is useful for AP CSA students learning about arrays and spatial orientation.

      Returns:
      int array containing [roll, pitch, yaw] angle values in degrees
      Since:
      1.0
